inn1.comm: starts off with one that bounces well in front of the keeper after Amla lets it go through outside off
lovely shot, emphasises the easy nature of the pitch too, as Amla sits back in the crease, and punches this square of his hips, keeping it down without any trouble
short and wide, and spanked away, doesn't even bother about getting close to it, and cuts it off the front foot, into the face of Afridi on a boundary board at point
straighter, fuller, makes him play it to mid-off
short and wide again, and Amla is cutting them towards the boundary board with Afirdi's face on it. Misses it this time, though
best shot of the lot, punched away through covers, that crisp sound off the bat comes too... they have given him width thrice, and Amla has taken 12 runs off them
and a poor loosener has been sent away for four... short, gentle pace, down the leg side, and he pulls it fine of fine leg. Good start for RP
hands over the strike to Amla with a single wide of mid-on
what is this man on? He is not hitting anything to the fielders... short again, slight width, and Amla punches it between cover-point and cover. Four more
fuller, closer to the stumps, Amla defends... only to see the ball bounce over the stumps. He must have had a nervous moment there
another delivery keeps low - it is two in two overs now that haven't reached the keeper without bouncing twice
angling into the pads, pushed to mid-on
better stuff from Akhtar, 145.6ks, back of a length, around off, defended by Peterson
looks for a cut shot, and is beaten outside off
another crisp shot, but hit straight to cover-point
slower ball, drops and runs to point, and Amla is a bit slow too. Asad Shafiq, though, misses the direct hit. Would have got Amla
just back of a length, around off, Amla stays back and defends
hit down to mid-off without much power
bowled'im! Poor shot really, playing across the line of a straight delivery headed for the off stump. Swings all around it, and the off stumps leaves its groove
similar delivery to the one that got Peterson, and Ingram plays it down the ground, to mid-on
left alone outside off
slight movement away from the left-hander, Ingram covers it and pushes this to cover
bowled within the stumps, Ingram turns this to midwicket
wicket-maiden, good comeback by Razzaq after a horrible start in the first over. This one has been left alone outside off
nice, crunchy punch shot again, but finds mid-off with this one
stays low outside off, Amla has to abort that punch shot and is forced to defend
again hit on the up, but there hasn't been much room this over, and this one too is hit to mid-off
slower ball, 122ks, adjusts nicely, and guides this past slip for a single
back of a length, close to off, defended to cover
plays and misses around off, and again the ball doesn't carry to the keeper
shuffles across to the ball bowled wide outside off, but it stays low, and Amla plays a defensive shot
punched away square, but straight to the backward point
nicely done, gets around the strong off-side field, shuffling across, and flicking this from wide outside off, through midwicket, for four
length ball, around off, hit back to Razzaq
hits hard down the ground, but the ball holds on a touch and th ball goes in the air, towards mid-off. But bounces just short
another good-looking shot, but hit straight to extra cover
slower offcutter, 125.1ks, headed towards off stump, and Ingram defends it towards mid-off
faster, shorter, wider, Ingram goes for the cut and is beaten. It bounces in front of the keeper again
and a slower offcutter again, and Ingram defends it to short cover - he has faced 10 balls now without getting off the mark
punched away to cover, not much room on offer
again he is stump to stump, and Ingram defends this towards cover
middle and off again, and another dot ball - second maiden of the innings. Good comeback by Pakistan after that loose start
shortish outside off, guided down to third man for one

he is off the mark, off the 14th delivery he has faced, and in streaky fashion here - pushing at the ball with hard hands, the ball doesn't quite bounce, and hits the low, outside edge, going between the keeper and the slip
and Ingram is beaten again, pushing outside off again, down the wrong line
that is more of what Ingram would want, punching this wide of mid-on, taking it from the pads, on the up, and finding the gap
shimmies down the track, and turns this towards square leg
slower ball around off, Ingram covers the line and defends
lovely shot again, Amla gets width after a long time and punches it off the back foot, beating backward point
more width here, and he has cut this one, right of backward point this time
fuller, closer to the stumps, and hit back to the bowler
looks to whip this one through the leg side, gets an inside edge onto the pad
Ingram looking to hit out here. Dances down the track and gets an inside edge towards short midwicket
slower offcutter, pitches leg, spin towards middle, defended to off side
shuffles across to Razzaq again, and flicks it wide of deep square leg for a couple
walks across again and hits this to deep square leg from wide outside off

that's a second edged boundary out of the 12 runs Ingram has scored! Looking to cut one that is too close to him, and the edge flies wide of keeper. Not sure why a captain would take the slip out when the same batsman edged the same bowler for four in the previous over, just managing to avoid the slip
cut away, misfielded at point by Fawad, giving away a single
steered away to third man for one
Ingram looks in now! What a slap of a shot, dancing down and lofting this length ball over long-on. What a clean strike, and Ingram needed one of those badly after a scratchy start
around off, not much turn, hit back to the bowler
turning into the pads, worked away for one
swept away fine, from in front of leg, to short fine leg
beaten on the cut shot
angled into the pads, hit straight to midwicket
cut away, straight to point
poor start, straight innocuous delivery on the pads, and Amla gets an inside edge onto the pad, which goes away to fine leg for four
fuller, closer to off, hit back to the bowler
length ball, hit straight to mid-off
punched down the ground, not enough power behind it, and takes a single straight of mid-off
length ball around off, hit back to the bowler
shimmies down the track, and pushes this flighted delivery to long-on for one
shortish, cut away, finds cover-point
swept from in front of middle, can't beat short fine leg
tossed up, no turn on it, hit down to mid-on
within the stumps, pushed to long-off for one
turning into the pads, whipped away for a single
for a change, extra bounce! Amla shuffles across, looks to pull it from outside off, and is hit in the rib area
gets the width, cuts it off the front foot, but finds point
slower ball wide outside off, Amla lets it go, hoping for a wide, but not given
full and wide, driven wide of sweeper-cover for two
beautiful punch shot down the ground, Afridi at mid-off has to make a full-length dive to his right to save three runs here
around off, Ingram stays back and defends
pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
whipped away into the leg side, with the turn
swept away powerfully, from outside off, wide of deep square leg
driven on the up, to extra cover
sees him charging down the track, bowls flat and fast, making him play a defensive shot
stays in the crease to push this down to long-off
angling into the pads, turned away for a single
steered away from in front of off, towards third man, and that's a fifty for Amla - the seventh time he has reached the landmark this year. Four of those he has converted into centuries
Ingram looks to play the steer shot too, and is beaten outside off
length ball, close to off, hit down to mid-off
slower ball, Ingram plays with an open face
into the ribs, pulled away to fine leg for one
punched away square, to deep point
flighted around off, pushed back to the bowler
shimmies down the pitch, playing this back to the bowler
whipped away square of short fine, and fine of deep square, gets two
superb late-cut, using the pace on Hafeez's quicker delivery, getting it fine of short third
driven straight to extra cover
punched down the ground, but straight to mid-off
steered down to third man for a single
tight line, middle and off, Ingram pushes this to midwicket
slower one gone wrong, down the leg side, Ingram gets a faint touch to what would surely have been a wide
another slower ball, around off this time, and he opens the face on it to run it down to third man
steered down to third man for a single
turning into the pads, worked away for one
worked away into the leg side for a single
guided to deep point with an open face
another single to deep point
worked around the corner for another single
full on the pads, gets a single to long-on
flicked to midwicket, with the angle
plays with an open face, gets a single to third man
played down the ground, between mid-off and mid-on for a single
slower ball, cut away, and Alam makes a nice diving save at backward-point
punched away, gets a single wide of mid-off
not for the first time, Ingram is beaten when trying the cut shot, again because of low bounce
flicked away off the back foot, between long-on and deep midwicket, and they come back for two
flighted wide of off, gets a single to sweeper-cover, becoming the highest run-getter in ODIs this year
googly, Ingram plays for the turn, and is beaten
another googly, and an edge this time, wide of keeper, fine of where the first slip would have been. That;s the third such boundary Ingram has scored today
worked away off the pads

and Afridi - not for the first time in his career - dismisses a batsman who has played him for the turn. This is nicely flighted around off, Amla plays a forward defensive, expecting the ball to turn a touch, but it goes straight on, and Aleem Dar upholds the lbw appeal. Amla doesn't look too happy. It hits him right in front, but Amla probably suggests an edge, which replays don't confirm
another play and miss from Ingram outside off, playing under the ball as he looks to cut this one
gets a single to third man
moves across and plays and misses, is hit on the pad, but the ball is pitched outside leg
defends a back-of-a-length delivery off the back foot
presses half forward and plays a defensive shot
shuffles across, off-drives a full and wide delivery, hits it to mid-off
flighted outside off, defended towards cover
Ingram's fortuitous stay continues, as he gets a top edge on a sweep shot, which falls short of deep square leg
googly, pushed towards cover
driven powerfully, straight to extra cover
cut away in front of square, just wide of sweeper-cover, and they hare back for two
googly again, but too short, and easily cut away for one
quick and flat offbreak, beats Ingram on the cut. This isn't full enough for that shot anyway. Seems like Ingram can get away with all sins today
presses right forward to defends
short, stays low, forced away into the off side for one
nicely worked away into the leg side, with the turn
flighted on the pads, wide of long-on, and they pick their man to take two off - Shoaib Akhtar
offbreak pitched on the pads, worked away for a single
misfielded by Alam at extra cover, through him really, two more

it's fitting that Ingram should get to his fifty off an outside edge, with a single to short third man. He has been lucky today all right, but the scoreboard has only so much space, and it right now says he has got his first ODI fifty
played to midwicket
jumps down the track, and can't make connection, looking to defend. Gets a le-bye, though - this innings' first
long hop, and he has pulled it nicely, between long-on and deep midwicket
delicate late-cut, past slip, along the ground
wide down the leg side, but the stumping is missed as Ingram overbalances, pushing himself out of the crease. Zulqarnain, though, can't make a clean collection
and now Ingram rubs it in, with a superb cover drive, wide of extra cover
looks for the late-cut, can't beat backward point
full and wide, square-driven down to deep point for one
doosra, AB covers the turn and defends
big offbreak this time, beats him, but is headed down the leg side when it hits his pad
full and fast, around off, defended
front-of-the-hand offbreak, driven powerfully, but straight to extra cover
flicked down to long-off for a single
looped up around leg, AB gets an easy single
offbreak again, cut away for one
presses forward and defends this back to the bowler
defends this with an open face
shorter, and he stays back and pushes it down to long-on for a single
nicely chipped away - deliberately so as it doesn't carry to deep fielders on the leg side - gets a couple
played along the ground into the leg side, gets another single
plays for the turn, this one comes in with the angle, gets a leg-bye - but it's given a run. Perhaps a thin edge was there
sharp offbreak, there is half a shout for lbw, the bowler suggesting it hit the pad first, but the umpire says bat first
flat and back of a length, pushed to extra cover
offbreak around leg, played into the on side for a single
comes down the track, and guides this wide of deep midwicket for two
punched away to sweeper-cover for one
offbreak again, too full, and driven down to long-off for one
comes down the track again, but can't get this past extra cover
another outside edge, another four for Ingram. After the game tonight, Ingram should hit a casino. He will wipe the house. Afridi not happy with the short third man, Hafeez, who dives in slow motion
and again... Ingram's fifth boundary through an outside edge! Very well bowled, sharp offbreak, and the edge beats the keeper, and there is no slip. This man has done enough to deserve a slip today
pushed straight to cover

Ingram is gone? No he is not. They try a sharp single to point, Ingram is sent back, and he has to put in a big desperate dive. It seems the bat is in the air as he dives... the protracted lower part of the bat seems to be up in the air as Zulqarnain dislodges the bails, but it is all very close, and they have given him not out. Don't know what to make of that decision, but I would have called that out, because I couldn't see any part of the bat behind the line... Benefit of doubt will surely be evoked here
angled into the pads, worked away into the on side
pushed to long-off for one
pushed wide of cover-point for a single
runs this down the third man for one
looks to cut but this is too full for the shot
cut away well this time, gets a single to sweeper-cover
pushed towards cover-point off the back foot
googly, which is a bit too short, and Ingram is quick to rock back and cut it wide of point for four. In between those edged boundaries, Ingram has played some nice shots too
turning into the pads, played to midwicket
lovely shot, dances down the track, and lofts him over midwicket. Doesn't look for power, just wants to clear the fielder in the ring
flatter delivery, pushed down to long-on for one
played with an open face, gets a single to short third man
pushed back to the bowler
plays the similar shot, but gets it wide of the bowler for a single
another sharp single, taking the Pakistan fielders on, hitting straight to cover, and haring through, beating the throw with a big dive
pushed down to long-n for a single
offcutter, cut away, and Shoaib makes a save diving to his left, at short third
looks for the late-cut, but finds point
flighted deliver, driven straight to extra cover
turned towards midwicket for one - the midwicket fielder is at the boundary
short and wide, cut in front of square, and Asad Shafiq makes a diving save at cover
wide down the leg side
worked away off the hip for a single
short ball, goes for the pull, and is beaten by the low bounce
slower ball, and the steal a single straight to backward point
worked off the pads into the leg side
short and wide, cut away, wide of deep point, gets two runs for it
left alone outside off
full on the pads, worked away for one
full on the pads, flicked away for a single
shortish, outside off, pushed wide of long-off, and they come back for two
played straight to long-off this time, gets a single
goes inside-out from leg-stump line, gets a single to sweeper-cover
shuffles across to work this into the on side for one
back of a length, gets the toe end of the bat on it, and takes a single to short third man
slower ball, ends up dragging the shot into the leg side
short, into the ribs, nicely bowler, Ingram defends
slower ball again, beats him on the punch shot
another slower ball, offcutter, starting middle, turning towards off, Ingram plays it back to him
quicker delivery, angling down the leg side, hitting him in the pad
comes down the track and drives him down to long-off
short outside off, cut away to deep point
bowled'im! Comes down the track again, and ends up yorking himself. The ball squeezes under the bat, and takes the off stump out
full outside off, driven down to long-off for one
googly, turning away from wide outside off, called wide, rightly so
legbreak this time, goes deep into the crease to work it into the on side
short, widish outside off, cut away to Alam at backward point
moves across the stumps, is hit high on the thigh pad, gets a leg-bye - given run, could been a thin edge
beaten when looking to turn this to leg, but it was pitched outside leg, and hence no appeal
stays back and defends a short-of-a-length delivery
slower offcutter, driven to straightish extra cover
a bouncer well bowled, Duminy fends at it to save his chest area, and gets a couple of runs fine of fine leg
offbreak, around off, and he defends it to cover
short, wide outside off, cut straight to extra cover
tries the late-cut, but the short third man is very fine
he spoils a good over by bowling a long hop - gentle half tracker, and he pulls it through midwicket for four
fuller, offbreak, and driven to long-off for one
short and gives him room, Duminy cuts it away and takes three by the time sweeper-cover makes a diving save and returns the ball
swept away powerfully, that was superbly done, splitting the two fielders in the deep on the on side
pushed down to long-off for a single
guides this one to sweeper-cover to move to 99
full outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover

shortish, cut away for a single that gets him his hundred. He jumps for joy, and the whole team stands up and applauds his effort. Not the best innings he will play,but he will take this century - at least 20 of those runs have come through edges, and he has enjoyed a missed stumping too
guided down to short third man but gets no run

Riaz has got him with a swinging low full toss, nearly a yorker. Ingram is limping his way back to the pavilion - it got him straight on the toe or the angle, but on first look it seemed like swinging down the leg side. Replays confirm my view. Ironic that the man who enjoyed such good luck through the innings gets an ordinary decision at the end of it all. Nothing to take away from the superb late reverse swing
nice bouncer, hits him in the chest area
another yorker, reversing again, he digs it out for one

slower ball, very well bowled, and Duminy - already looking for a paddle sweep - lets the ball hit his shoulder, and claims the leg-bye even though he didn't play a shot at all. That same old rule of leg-byes-while-taking-protective-action?
short ball, pulled wide of mid-on for two
another two, guided wide of deep backward square
yorks him as Duminy looks to come down the track
another flat delivery, within the stumps, hit down the ground for a single
again, flat, straight and fast, gets a bottom-side edge
looks to make room and cut, but can't beat the cover ring
backs away again, Hafeez follows him up, and he goes for the pull shot, but all the deep fielders are on the leg side
gets a single straight to extra cover
that's unlucky! Riaz bowls a yorker on middle and leg, JP digs it out, and the inside edge takes it fine of short fine for four
slower ball beats him, but he gets a leg-bye
sees Miller make room, and bowls wide of off, and gets a dot ball through. Smart bowling
another reversing delivery, but a full toss, hits him on the pad down the leg side, and he gets a leg-bye
slower ball, cut to backward point, and they steal a single. Asad Shafiq misses the direct-hit
Wahab gets another! This is good bowling at death. Bowls a sharp bouncer, heading towards the batsman's head, Miller backs away and pulls, gets a top edge that Wahab runs to his left and claims
Hafeez yorks him, conceding a single into the on side
low full toss, driven powerfully and straight to extra cover
pushed wide of long-on for two
short, on the pads, worked away into the leg side for one

timber! stops before letting the delivery through - a modern habit of modern offies - and then lets a quick offbreak rip, Morkel is caught deep in the crease, playing across its line, and it squeezes through to take the middle stump out
driven hard but back to the bowler
slower ball, worked into the on side for one
back of a length, around off, Botha drops and runs and hands over the strike to JP
length ball, driven wide of mid-off for one
short, into the ribs, Botha turns down the single JP wants as t hasn't really gone anywhere but straight to square leg
another short ball, hits him in the thigh pad, gets a leg-bye
short again, JP gets a bottom edge on the pull, gets a single
flat, on the pads, pushed to long-on for one
flicked to midwicket for a single
short, hit straight to extra cover, and they take the single off Shoaib Akhtar
tossed up around middle and leg, and they take a single into the on side

flat offbreak, 88.7ks, eats him on the late-cut, Zulqarnain doesn't collect it cleanly, and although it seems JP might have fallen over and out of the crease, the back foot always stays behind the crease
worked away off the pads for one
nice yorker, swinging in late, and pitching on the crease. JP can't do much else with it than dig it out
just short of being a yorker and he plays it with an open face, wide of deep point and the poor wide throw from Asad Shafiq lets them get the second easily
slower ball, played with an open face, gets a single to backward point
bouncer, but down the leg side, and it's called a wide
inside edge for four! Botha throws his bat at this length ball outside off, and the edge misses both the stumps and the keeper
slower ball, hit to midwicket for one
driven to sweeper-cover for one. Wahab's quota of 10 ends for 43 runs and two wickets
runs this down to third man for a single
nearly a yorker, digs it out towards long-on for one
slower ball, guides it square of third man for a couple
plays a chip shot to a length ball that almost carries to Younus Khan at long-off. Slower ball it was
backs away to make room, Akhtar follows him, and Duminy gets a single to midwicket
lovely yorker, swinging in late, landing on the crease, played back to him
Botha has run himself out by backing up too far! Duminy's shot hits him in the pads as he is running up the pitch, the ricochet goes straight to Hafeez who finishes a simple run-out
superb shot from JP, clears the front leg, gets under a flat length ball, and lofts it straight over Hafeez's head for six
sees him charge down and fires it in flat, on the pads, Duminy turns it around the corner for one
stays back and defends a fullish delivery
charges down the track and pushes one down to long-off for one
wide down the leg side
offbreak around middle, opens the face on it, and retains the strike for the final over of the innings
slower ball, following him as he backs away, and the chip shot lands safe in the leg side
makes room and guides this wide of deep point for two - fifty up for JP, and it is an important innings that has made sure SA don't completely lose their way with wickets falling all around him

slower ball, pulled away, and it lobs Asad Shafiq on the deep square leg boundary. It's embarrassing for any deep fielder who sees the ball sail over him and then bounce inside the boundary. And it's quite brainless why he was standing way inside the boundary in the last over of the innings. Shoaib rightly gives him an earful
Fawad Alam has placed himself correctly at long-on as JP Duminy drills it straight down his throat. Powerful shot, but perhaps got a bit too close to it and didn't get the elevation to clear long-on
and immediately clears the front leg and lofts him over third man, what a shot from the No. 10 - it was inches short of being a yorker
beats him with a bouncer, but the Saffers are alert and steal a bye

inn2.comm: gentle half-volley on the pads, worked away for one to fine leg
short and slightly wide, and Hafeez has punched this away beautifully between backward point and cover-point. High on his toes and getting on the top of the bounce
gets closer to the stumps this time, hit back to the bowler
gentle length ball on middle and driven powerfully on the up, and it was hit so hard it burst through the stumps and got him two runs
extra bounce there, beats him as Hafeez looks to cut
sharp inward movement, hits him on the pad but angling down the leg side
full outside off, no swing, driven to mid-off
another full and wide delivery, driven again, but straight to cover
starts wide, keeps on going with the angle, left alone
looks to drive at a length ball outside off, gets an inside edge that goes towards square leg
back of a length, close to off, hit to cover
driven towards cover, still can't find the gap - maiden over for Tsotsobe
back of a length, around off, defended back to Langeveldt
moves across the stump and misses. There is naturally a big shout, but perhaps it is heading down the leg side. Rightly called not out, but dangerous shot
gone! This is short and there for the pull but Asad is late into the shot, and the top edge skies towards mid-on where Morne Morkel takes the catch moving backwards
nearly another wicket, sharp inward movement, beats him, but it is not given lbw because it has hit him in the thigh and might have gone over the stumps
tips and runs, gets a single to midwicket
YK steers a short and wide delivery to third man for one
that is nasty. This bouncer rises from just back of a length, and Younis's both feet are in the air as he keeps this down
nicely driven on the up, but straight to Amla at short cover, on first bounce
looks to drive again, but is not quite close to the line of the ball, and ends up inside-edging it back to the bowler
shuffles slightly across and pushes this back to the bowler
short and wide but gets a touch big and Younis does well to keep the cut shot down. Duminy makes a diving save at backward point
finally Pakistan find a gap through the cover field. YK doesn't look to hit this wide delivery too hard, just places it wide of short cover. The timing is superb. First runs off Tsotsobe
length ball, just outside off, played towards point, and they pinch a single
just back of a length, hit towards mid-off
slower ball, and YK picks it early, comes forward, and flicks it between mid-on and midwicket. Top shot
well bowled, slight movement in from outside off, Younis ends up driving outside the line of it. Lucky to not get an edge

cracking shot, Younis Khan is timing them sweetly here. Moves across a bit to get close to the line of a wide delivery and just meets it with an open face, gets it between backward point and cover-point
shorter, closer to the stumps, and Younis gets right behind it and defends
angled across Hafeez, who lets it go through to the keeper
another pinched single that Younis initiates. He is running well here. Hafeez just dropped it towards square leg and saw YK harind up towards the danger end, and went himself too
oh what a beautiful shot! Lovely cover drive. On the up. High elbow. All along the ground. Wide of mid-off. Straight of extra cover. Where are the photographers?
slightly slower and this time Younis plays it squarer. Can't beat backward point this time
gets right forward to defend this one around off
looks for a drive again and ends up reaching for this one wide outside off, gets an inside egde back to the bowler
nicely punched on the up, but straight to cover
slightly slower, Hafeez plays away from the body, gets an inside edge that brings Younis on the strike
slower ball again, played with an open face towards point
angling into the pads, flicked away, but straight to short midwicket
stump to stump again, hit down to mid-on
length ball, outside off, played to cover
left alone outside off
gets an inside edge as he plays away from the body, gets a single to fine leg
expansive drive outside off, and makes no contact to a ball that goes straight with the angle
back of a length, angling across, hit straight to cover-point
that's well bowled, seaming away from middle and off, and beating him on the drive
gets a single this time, working it away off the pads, into the leg side

that is plumb, or is it? Rod Tucker sends YK on his way. It was bowled stump to stump, and the slight inside movement beat Younis. Hang on, hang on! The replays show Younis got an inside edge on it. Not quite plumb, but it looked like that live time
plays a shortish delivery towards cover
nearly another wicket for Langeveldt as Misbah gets an inside edge on that defensive shot. The ball rolls past the leg stump
angling into the pads, and hit straight to short fine
slower ball gets an outside edge, but it doesn't carry through to the keeper
worked away off the hip, wide of short fine leg, gets a single
straight ball going across with the angle, still Misbah manages to play way outside the line of it
back of a length, played to short cover
offcutter, that moves away late and beats him. Inches away from the outside edge
presses forward and defends this with an open face
poor delivery, wide half-volley at gentle pace, and Misbah drives it nicely wide of cover
closer to the stumps this time, and shorter too, defended back to him
nice start, gets nice bounce, off a length, making Hafeez stand tall and defend
back of a length, guides wide of mid-on for one
nice cut shot, right on top of the bounce, but Albie Morkel makes a diving save, running across from third man
guided with an open face, to third man
cut away straight to cover-point. Morkel will want to get slightly closer to the stumps
aggression! Morkel fields this in his follow through, and lets the throw rip, hitting the stumps out of the ground. And replays show Hafeez had just about grounded the bat when the stumps came out
inside edge towards short fine leg as he pushes away from his body
shuffles across and plays a widish delivery towards point
gets a thick outside edge pushing away from the body, wide of slip it goes
slower offcutter, beats his outside edge, and bounces short of the keeper
across the line to a delivery outside off, and it beats has outside edge again
comes forward to defend this to cover
beaten outside off, as there is extra bounce on this
moves across the stumps to place this wide of deep square and come back for two
shuffles across again, but plays it to point this time
presses forward to defend this to point
goes for the pull, clearly late into it, and ends up hitting it to mid-on
short outside off, opens his face on it, and plays it to backward point
back of a length, outside off, punched to cover
nice shot, angling into the pads, with the fine leg up, and he places it past that man
driven off the front foot, to point, with an open face
too short, too gentle, and Misbah pulls it between mid-on and midwicket. Loose delivery all right, and he cashes in
punched off the back foot, through the cover field
this one stops at him a bit and he ends up chipping it over the infield on the on side
wide outside off, and steered to third man for a single
short, into the ribs, pulled away to fine leg
angling into the stumps, stays back, and plays it towards midwicket
defends this off the back foot
gets a thick inside edge on the drive, gets a couple of runs as the ball goes between deep square leg and deep midwicket
pushed uppishly towards midwicket
flat delivery, no spin, hit back to the bowler
repeat of the previous delivery, the ball is skidding through

and the third ball in a row doesn't spin, but Misbah plays for the turn, thus sealing his downfall. If I were playing Pakistan, I would fill my teams with left-arm spinners. Really. How Pakistan batsman manage is beyond me. This time Misbah stretches forward and plays outside the line of the ball. Hit on knee roll, stretching forward, but hit right in front
defends this off the front foot
guides this to third man for one
pushed to cover-point for a single
pulled in front of square, clears midwicket even though he doesn't connect perfectly
driven straight to cover
nice calculated shot here, sees mid-on is up, gets under a length delivery and goes over the infield
steered away to third man for one
half a shout for lbw from Morne, but he soon realises this is pitched well outside leg
shuffles across, gets an inside edge onto the pad as the ball gets a touch big on him
on target, no turn still, defended to cover
played back to the bowler
shorter, cut away for one
short again, pushed down to long-on for one
comes down the track and pushes it into the leg side
full and straight, played back to the bowler
Hafeez stretches forward and plays a defensive shot
back of a length, stays back and hits it back to Botha

Botha strikes in his first over! Looks for the late-cut, but it isn't quite short enough for the shot, and AB goes up spontaneously as soon as he competes the collection. Hafeez doesn't looks too unhappy while walking back either
tosses this up wide, Afridi places it wide of point for one
tossed up, Alam gets across, covers the line, opens the face
flat delivery, crunched away, but straight to cover
pushed down the ground for a single
flat, into the pads, hit to deep midwicket for one
full, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
short, into the pads, and Afridi flick/pulls it smack between long-on and deep midwicket. Lovely power he generates there
gets an inside edge as this one skids through, but he is safe
tossed up around middle and off, Afridi is shaping up for a biggie, but blocks it in the end
placed wide of point for a single

nicely bowled, lopped up, teasing Afridi, who can't hold himself back, goes for a big hit without any feet movement. As it turns it out, the ball pitches shorter than he expects, and the inside edge that results misses the stumps
shorter, flatter, placed wide of deep point for two
pushes this wide of cover for one
defended off the front foot

Botha can't believe he hasn't got him here. Pushes in the quicker one, full and fast, and appeals as soon as he hits Alam's pad, and carries on appealing. Tucker, though, is not convinced. That was hitting the middle of middle stump, by the way, and half the ball was inside the line of off at the point of impact
pushed to midwicket for one
opens the face of the bat, gets a single to short third man
swept away, but straight to short fine
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
driven to midwicket, straight to the fielder
plays the paddle sweep, gets a single
tossed outside off, defended to cover
another forward defensive
quicker ball again, but Alam gets the at down in time this time

Afridi charges down the track and hits this flighted delivery with all his might. Because he has got too close to the pitch of it, he doesn't get elevation, but he has hit it so hard it still almost carries to long-off
defended with an open face
lovely shot! Both touch and power here. Makes room, goes inside out, which is class. And also hits the pants off this ball. Gets four
Boom Boom! The crowd at its loudest today, and why not? Afridi has played another beautiful shot, charging down, making room, and lofting him over long-off. Clean as a whistle
swings the bat again, but misses. No feet there
swept away powerfully, from outside off, gets a single
forward defensive
pushes this wide of point for a single
full ball, driven down to long-off for one
paddled away from outside off, gets a single
straight delivery, no turn, looking for the lbw, Alam comes forward and defends
stretches forward and pushes this to long-off
sees Afridi back away, tosses it wide of off, still called wide. Fairly so, I suppose
does the same again as Afridi backs away. This time, though, it breaks in, and is not called wide
another paddle sweep, another single
and he is greeted by a flashy shot from Afridi, wide of backward point
opens the face on this one, guiding it to third man
shuffles across to defend this shortish ball
looks to tip and run, but hasn't created any distance between the ball and Langeveldt
opens the face, gets it past point, takes a single
top shot! Afridi is turning it on. length ball outside off, and he goes inside out, connecting cleanly, and clears the extra-cover boundary
punches a wide delivery to point for one
length ball, around off, steered away to third man for one
gets this length ball past point, brings Afridi back on strike
bouncer, not the full blooded one. Afridi looks for the upper cut, but is beaten by the bounce
slower bouncer, and Afridi is beaten again. This is good bowling. Will be interesting to see how Afridi reacts to these two bouncers
pushes this up wide of off, Afridi is not looking for a big shot, and punches it to point
Alam drives this wide half-volley, past extra cover, comes back for the second
worked away off the pads, gets a single to deep square leg
length ball, within the stumps, hit back to the bowler
angled across him, Afridi swings at it, doesn't quite connect but clears mid-off and comes back for two
angled across him, opens the face on it, and collects a couple
drops this to cover with soft hands and rushes across for one
back of a length, gets a thick leading edge, past point, wide of sweeper-cover. Afridi comes back for the second
slightly fuller, catching him on the back foot, the inside edge doesn't make it to the stumps

this time staying deep in the crease helps. Morkel bowls the bouncer, Afridi is ready for it, and pulls it high over midwicket. Not the sweetest of shots, but he knows he needs to just clear midwicket, and he does that with ease
fuller, around off, seamed a bit (maybe not), and beats his outside edge
that's the meaner bouncer, and it gets big on him and beats the pull shot for the bounce
back of a length, around off, beats his attempt to squeeze it through the covers
Alam gets across, opens the face, takes the single, leaves it to Afridi

there comes the inexplicably poor shot! Afridi knows the long-on is placed, and this is not even a half-volley, but goes ahead with the attempt to clear long-on regardless. The mis-hit threatens to land short of long-on, but Ingram takes a nice, running-in catch. The umpires ask Afridi to wait a moment because they are not sure if this is a no-ball, a trend started by Billy Bowden. The ball is good. Afridi is gone. He was good while he lasted, but got out in frustrating manner
left alone outside off
left alone outside off again
angling into the pads, Alam collects a single
slower offcutter, pitches outside leg, heads towards middle and off. Razzaq defends
full delivery, driven down to long-off for one
another full delivery, driven down to long-on
plays with the open face, can't beat short third man
shorter, pushed to extra cover
tossed up, driven to extra cover
another forward defensive from Alam
angled into the pads, as is his wont, finds the pad
gets a thick inside edge to deep backward square
Peterson gets one to turn. Stop the press. Alam is surprised, and is beaten
fuller now, outside off, played back to the bowler
pushed to long-off for one
flat, into the pads, worked away for one
looks to hit this one hard, but the ball stays low, and he plays with an open face towards point
opens the face late again, finds point again
worked around the corner for one
comes down the ground, pushes this to long-off for one
around the pads, worked away for one
drags it short, and Alam rocks back and pulls it between long-on and deep midwicket. His first boundary
what a shot from Razzaq! Perhaps the best of the night. Getting to the pitch of an unremarkable delivery and hitting him for a flat, straight six
cut to short third man
appeal for stumping. Third umpire rightly calls it not out. Razzaq goes for the big heave, Peterson tosses it up wide, Razzaq drags the foot out, but makes it back in time
tossed up wide again, and Razzaq fails to make contact again
flatter, closer to the stumps, just holds its line, and beats a defensive poke
flights it wide of off, and Razzaq goes for the more classical extra-cover drive, and connects beautifully. All along the ground, and into the gap
comes down the track and pushes this to long-off for one
flat around pads, pushed back to the right of the bowler
wide down the leg side
quicker one, gets a thick inside edge for a single into the leg side
punched into the off side for one
worked around the corner for a single
flighted around off, defended towards point
slower ball, short and wide, cut away, misfielded by Duminy at point
steered to third man for a single
nicely played, shaping up for the big shot, then spotting the slower ball, and running it down to third man
bouncer, Alam in no position to play that, and pulls down the wrong height
he breaks free... slower ball, he reads it early and then comes down the track to pull it over midwicket
plays this with soft hands, steals a single to cover
and Alam swings at a delivery away from him. Called a wide
tips and runs, then sends Razzaq back, who makes it back in time
tips and runs again, this time Peterson's misfield at straightish extra cover helps them take the single
wide down the leg side
left alone outside off
bouncer outside off, Razzaq leaves it alone
back of a length, holding its line outside off, beating his defensive poke at it
another delivery left alone outside off
angling into the pads, worked away for a single
punched to point
wide outside off, cut away to third man for one
clears the front leg, hits it down to long-off for one
short and wide, looks to upper-cut it, but is beaten by the extra bounce
incredible shot! He has spent the last six-seven deliveries leaving alone, defending, Test-match style, and suddenly he lofts this with an open face, and clears the deep point
Alam pushes a short delivery down to long-off for one
looks for the late-cut, but the ball is not quite short enough, and is beaten
well bowled, short of a length, just outside off, getting it to hold its line, and beating him outside off
angling into the pads, misses out on this and gets only a leg-bye
gets an inside edge for a single
into the pads again, and he flicks it down to fine leg for one
starts with a front-foot no-ball. Razzaq defends the shortish delivery
and Razzaq makes full use of it, clearing his front leg, and lofting it over deep midwicket. Length ball it was, and perfect for Razzaq to hit
slower delivery, and he pushes it down to long-off for one
bouncer outside off, Alam leaves it alone, called wide for height
slower ball, too full, pushed wide of cover with soft hands, comes back for two
driven this time, to extra cover
comes down the track, takes it on the full, gets a single to long-on
looks to run this down to third man, but is beaten by the slowness of it. Well bowled
and Alam shows his other side first ball, slog-sweeping a full ball from Botha, over mid-on, one-bounce for four
bowls full, fast and straight, defended back to the bowler
swept nicely, but finds square leg
full and fast and straight again, hit to the right of Botha who dashes across to field
pushes this one to cover for a single
Game. Is. On. Botha goes round the wicket, pitches it fullish, in Razzaq's swinging arc, and swing he does, over deep square leg for a six
bouncer from round the stumps, Alam gets in an awkward position when pulling, and is beaten
slower bouncer now, Alam still looks awkward, but keeps it down, and hands it over to Razzaq
Razzaq gets four more. Not the smartest of deliveries, full, outside off, almost a half-volley, and Razzaq throws the thing we do our dishes in at it. The thick edge flies over short third man
back of a length, wide of off, Razzaq clears the leg and swings, gets the toe end, towards long-off for one
ODI wicket No. 100 for Langeveldt! Another Pakistani misses a fifty. Fawad sees a length ball and goes after it, but ends up slicing it straight to extra cover
gets the old-fashioned outside edge that the tailenders so love. But the third man is fine, and Ingram there makes a nice diving save to keep them down to two
lovely start, Morne is the only bowler who has troubled Razzaq. Back of a length, around off, holding its line, beating the outside edge
almost a replay of the first ball, beating the outside edge again
fuller, around off, looks to nudge it into a gap, but gets an inside edge onto the pad, takes a single
Zulqarnain tries the ramp shot, but this is short and not in that shot's range. In fact the ball hits his glove, as opposed to he hitting the ball, and lobs over the keeper's head
just short of driving length, straight within the stumps, defended back
shortish, widish, left alone! Last ball of the over! Not even looking for a single to take strike for the next over. What a batsman
almost played on! Zulqi's inside edge this time frustrated SA, missing the off stump, then clearing the keeper, going for two
cut away, off the middle of the bat, but can't beat Botha at point
short ball, ducks under it
full and wide outside off, Zulqarnain goes after it and misses
slower bouncer, no room, Zulqarain is late into the shot, is in no position to play it, but the bll hangs in the air, and bounces short of the mid-off running in
Razzaq gets to fifty with a brutal drive through extra cover. This one asked for it, it was a wide half-volley, Razzaq opened his shoulders and let rip

superb work from Peterson at straightish midwicket. Zulqarnain can't do much with this shortish delivery, but he has no choice but to run. Peterson charges across, fields, and underarm-flicks it to hit the stumps direct
short and wide, cut away to deep point, but he turns down the single
no room, just back of a length, hit to point
no room whatsoever, and the length is that nagging in-between one, and a dot ball results
lovely shot! Slightly shorter, slight width there, and Razzaq uses all his pace to cut it so that he keeps it sufficiently in front of third man
Albie misses! Razzaq goes for the single having hit it straight to point, Riaz is prepared to sacrifice himself, but Albie misses the only stump visible to him
Razzaq gets a thick inside edge on this slog, gets a single to deep square
angled across him, Riaz plays with an open face, fails to make contact

drama. Lovely catch from AB. Riaz gets the edge to the slower ball, and the ball is dying on AB, but he dives forward to get his gloves under it. They check it with the third umpire, and they have been told something by the third umpire. And the batsman has been called back. Well let me reconsider and rephrase. To me it looked straight in, but the replays were not 100% conclusive. Hence given not-out, maybe?
slogs and misses now
yorker, well bowled, no run. It's getting all too steep
slogs at thin air. At least Razzaq will be on strike

shot! Razzaq is still fighting! What a clean, crisp connection. This is not full by any means, but Razzq has smoked this down the ground for a flat six over the leaping Duminy at long-off. It just kept going
comes back with a bouncer, Razzaq is not even in position to attempt a pull
right in his zone! Length ball, gentle pace, and Razzaq swings, swings hard, clearing long-on with ease. Razzaq is keeping this alive
short ball, swatted across the line, wide of long-on, and he comes back for two
Razzaq you beauty! Picks the slower ball, charges down, and hits it straight over Langeveldt's head for a flat six. He rarely ever hits those high sixes

superb work from Langeveldt here! SA are causing damage from the other end here. Razzaq looks to hit this full ball down the ground for one, Langeveldt sticks his left hand out and fields. Riaz has backed up too far and Langeveldt has enough time and more to aim for the stumps and run them down
played with an open face, straight to point. Razzaq has to go back
angled into the pads, takes the single, Razzaq on strike
well bowled, nearly a yorker, cramping him up, going through his legs

poor poor cricket from Ajmal! What was he doing here? I feel for Razzaq here. Back to what happened. Albie bowls another yorker, but a no-ball. Razzaq digs it out, it travels softly towards long-on, and obviously Razzaq wants to face the free hit, but Ajmal is sleeping. he responds too late to his call and is run out by a mile. Brainless cricket from Ajmal
low full toss, plays the pick-up shot, and finds the gap in that watertight leg-side field
another full ball to cramp him up, Razzaq digs it out, but declines the single
full toss on the pads, Razzaq politely takes the single, and with that the strike for the next over
whoa! Ho ho ho! Razzaq! Razzaq! Razzaq! And why are they bowling length to this man? Razzaq sees is and lofts him straight over his head for six
yorker outside off, can't get it past extra cover, turns down the single
short ball, down the leg side, SA are lucky it hit his body on the way, and AB makes a good diving save to his left
that click sound! that crisp shot! Langeveldt tries to bounce him, he clears his front leg and pulls, in front of square over midwicket. Akhtar is applauding him. Will he stand with him till the end?
full on the pads, hit straight of long-on, but they take just the single
full toss, straight at stumps, Shoaib keeps it out. Razzaq gets strike for the last over
and he hits the crease, down the leg side, cramping him up, going through his legs
smokinnnn! Razzaq on 99! What is he up to here? Low full toss, misses the length by inches, and smacks it over midwicket, into the grass banks. They are dancing out there. Razzaq is playing a beauty
Razzaq! Beaut! Poor delivery. On a length, in Razzaq's arc. He gets under it, goes over midwicket. Gets to 105. Botha is on the rope. Watches it sail over his head. Shine On You Crazy Diamond
short and wide, Razzaq wants to finish it off, misses the cut. AB and Albie appeal big time, but I don't see any connection there

Abdul. Razzaq. Sir, you have played a gem! Full ball outside off, when the leg side is heavily populated, and he crashes it through the field. Four runs! Game over. He emotes for the first time. Exults. He throws his bat, and then pumps fists. looks towards the dressing room. They are all celebrating. Shoaib picks up his bat. Hugs him. One by one all come out. Afridi. Waqar. All have one man to thank tonight
